data.title: Bomber with only one left.
data.solution:
import sys
import math

width = int(input())
height = int(input())
board = [input() for _ in range(height)]

def getScoreAt(x, y):
    if x < 0 or x >= width \
        or y < 0 or y >= height:
        return 0
    
    if board[y][x] == "A":
        return -99999
    else:
        return int(board[y][x])

maxScore = 0
posMaxScore = None
hasMultiple = False
for x in range(width):
    for y in range(height):
        score = getScoreAt(x - 1, y - 1) + \
                getScoreAt(x + 0, y - 1) + \
                getScoreAt(x + 1, y - 1) + \
                getScoreAt(x - 1, y + 0) + \
                getScoreAt(x + 0, y + 0) + \
                getScoreAt(x + 1, y + 0) + \
                getScoreAt(x - 1, y + 1) + \
                getScoreAt(x + 0, y + 1) + \
                getScoreAt(x + 1, y + 1)

        if score > maxScore:
            print(f"max score {score} at {x} {y}", file=sys.stderr)
            posMaxScore = (x, y)
            maxScore = score
            hasMultiple = False
        elif score == maxScore:
            print(f"multiple max score of {score} at {x} {y}", file=sys.stderr)
            hasMultiple = True

if posMaxScore is None:
    raise Exception("No possible solution")
if hasMultiple:
    raise Exception("Multiple solutions with the same maximum score")

x, y = posMaxScore
print(f"{x} {y}")
data.statement:
You are flying over enemy territory in a bomber. You have one bomb left and have to find the best spot to drop it.
Your bomb destroys everything in a 3x3 square. A square can either be an ally {{A}} or a target with score [[S]] represented by a single digit {{0-9}}.
Your task is to find the [[x]], [[y]] coordinates where the most damage can be inflicted, without hitting an ally (i.e. where the sum of scores is the highest in the 3x3 area around the coordinates).
data.constraints:
0 < [[W]] ≤ 16
0 < [[H]] ≤ 16
0 ≤ [[x]] < [[W]]
0 ≤ [[y]] < [[H]]

There always is a possible and only one best solution.
data.stubGenerator:
read width:int
read height:int
loop height read row:string(width)

write x y
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> the width [[W]] of the area
<<Line 2:>> the height [[H]] of the area
<<Next [[W]] lines:>> [[H]] characters either {{A}} or a digit {{0-9}}.
data.outputDescription:
One line with the [[x]] and [[y]] coordinates.
{{0 0}} is the top left.
[[W]]{{- 1}} [[H]]{{- 1}} is the bottom right.
